# Day 800

![[https://x.com/sethforprivacy/status/1796193291718816039](https://x.com/sethforprivacy/status/1796193291718816039)](https://miro.medium.com/1*SWWa0ji0xI-y0vIkuhm_Ow.png)

This picture sums up the vast majority of Government programs. It's a sad day for democracy. A jury in New York found Donald J. Trump guilty on all 34 counts of falsifying business records in his hush money trial. It's a historic moment, as he's the first former president to be found guilty of a felony. Not exactly the kind of "first" one would aspire to achieve, but here we are.

I'm not even the biggest fan of democracy. I find this Churchill quote to be apt:

> _'Many forms of Government have been tried, and will be tried in this world of sin and woe. No one pretends that democracy is perfect or all-wise. Indeed it has been said that democracy is the worst form of Government except for all those other forms that have been tried from time to time....'_

Of all the things to convict a politician for, they decide to do it for hush money to a porn star? If someone does not think this is a politically motivated trial, I would urge them to turn off the legacy media. Seriously, let's start convicting all the war criminals on both sides of the aisle. That would make the world a better place.

I watched Mad Max: Furiosa today, and it was a stark reminder of how swiftly society can descend into chaos. We often take the rule of law for granted, but the American people are not naive. I hope those in power realize the dangers of driving the world toward turmoil just to maintain their grip on authority. In such a scenario, everyone loses.

5/30/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
